instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Signs of liquid damage but doesn't look that bad, Get green then orange light on charger fan spins no display on internal  or external.

Board only on desk took these

ppbus_g3h - 12.53V
PP3V42_G3H - 3.41V
PPVRTC_G3H - 3.33V
PP5V_S5 - 5V
SMC_LID - 3.41V
PP3V3_S5 - 3.31V

Just waiting for the Ultrasonic to warm up and will run it through so if it makes any difference, probably not , What to try next?

Thanks in advance.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
CPU coils get voltage?
If yes, check PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message: I'm taking it L7320 & L7310 are the  two CPU coils,  Both reading 0v

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Do you get voltage on other coils?
Check level on pins 7 & 3 of U1950.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD goes high?

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Coils as follows 
L7130 - 12.52v
L7520 - 0v
L7430 - 0v
L3095 - 0.01v
L7560 - 3.33c

U1950 pin 7 = 1.070v pin 3 between 55 and 58Mv
All_sys_pwrgdm  Moves around a lot up and down between 130 and 180 Mv

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
I'm wondering how the fan spins, if you don't have 5V_S4 even.
The fan requires 5V_S0 in fact...

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message: Am I measuring something incorrectly? I deffinatly have fan spin! Also I just noticed that with just the board on the bench when connecting the magsafe it turns green when connected then quickly turns orange, isn't this odd behaviour with no battery attached?

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
You've said no voltage on L7520 (5V_S4).

Since Magsafe 2, light goes amber without battery.
It turns back to green with fully charged battery (100%).

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message: Did some playing around this morning, with the board on the bench I get no 5v readings at all except on one test point right next to L7520 that reads 5v but the coil dosent, put the board back into the mac wire it all up hit the power button fan spins and I get 5v readings on the coil and 5v_s4 and 5v_so but as before no chime no display

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message: When you get 5V_S4, check CPU coils and PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
both CPU coils are at 1.7v
PLT_RESET_L is at 3.27v

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
The battery is charging?
Check for USB activity on both ports.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
I have USB Power but don't seem to get any activity light flicker on either port, 

As for the battery charging, I have it plugged in now with the charger light orange, is there any other way of knowing if it is actually charging without just waiting to see if the light turns green? 

Magsafe feels warm like it's pulling Amps

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
I can confirm it is charging the battery, MagSafe just turned Green after 2 hours ish of charging, 

For checking USB activity I use an external HD with a working OS on it, Testing it on other working machines I get blinking light on the external HD when powering on the machine, Is this a a viable way of checking USB activity?

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
That's the best way for USB activity test.

About battery charging, just monitor PPBUS_G3H few seconds, when Magsafe light is amber.
It must slowly increase, when battery is charging.

Be sure to get all voltages from page 11.
Also check SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces; clean/remove J6100.
Try known good BIOS.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Got the board under the scope and tested J6100 was going to try cleaning / removing but it looks in perfect condition so started testing voltages from page 11,

starting from top left and working down that column all test perfect 3.33v until I get to C1208 reading 188.7mv,then
C1220- 0v
C1212- .222v
C1214-.213v
C1250 -03.6mv
C1255 -0v
C1260 -59.1mv
and so on,

 Have we found the area that the problem lies or is this a similar issue as happened above where I was getting incorrect readings with the board on the bench and not powered on back in the Mac?

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Seems that you've lost 3V3_S0 and 1V05_S0.
Are you sure to have voltage on all coils now?

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message: With the board in the mac and fan spinning I am getting  3V3_S0 and 1V05_S0  but checking the coils, all present and correct except for L3095 reading 0v

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
When you test the board alone on the desk, fan spins?
Do you get 3V3_S0 and 1V05_S0 then?

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message: Just tried the board on the desk with fan connected and no It has  NO fan spin at all and just Mv readings on  3V3_S0 and 0v on  1V05_S0

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message: 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger for sure?

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Oh ffs, what a noob I am :oops:!
Plugged in an 85w mag and of course the fan starts to spin, also just noticed while trying this again back in the mac adding one cable at a time that no matter what is connected and regardless of running on magsafe or battery when you turn it off by holding the power button after a couple of seconds it seems to power itself on again and the fan starts spinning and keeps spinning until I hold the power button down and disconnect the battery and the magsafe.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message: Also just tried to boot in smc bypass, I get full fan spin but still no display on external or internal screen.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message: Do all mentioned checkings...

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
ppbus_g3h - 12.53V
PP3V42_G3H - 3.41V
PPVRTC_G3H - 3.33V
PP5V_S5 - 5V
SMC_LID - 3.41V
PP3V3_S5 - 3.31V 

All the same as before

coils

L7130 = 12v
l7520 = 4.86v
l7560 = 3.25v
l3095 =0v
l7430 =1.369v
l7320 =1.7v
l3310 =1.7v

             pin 3 = goes crazy between .526v and 190.0mv

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Don't you get 3V at pin 2/U1950?

Remove U1950 and check its pads and board traces.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
OK removed  U1950  noticed that C1950 looked slightly corroded and it looked like a break in the trace , Removed C1950 and made sure I had repaired the trace getting 3v to pin 8,  

I got  3V at pin 2/U1950  now, 

But... I have blown U3560  into the abyss! ( How important is this? ) can I work without it or is this another board for parts bin?

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
It should work without it.
You probably don't need AP, or PCIE wake function.
You can place R3560, for AP wake...

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Ahh, That's cool! But even after getting correct voltages on U1950 I'm still getting fan spin,  cpu gets warm but no beep no display,

It's yet another one I feel that has beaten me :(

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Do you get 3V at pin 3/U1950?
Also check CPU coils and PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
"Do you get 3V at pin 3/U1950?"  = yes

 CPU Coils both at 1.7v

PLT_RESET_L = 0v

I also just noticed that since cleaning up U1950 I no longer get a constant fan spin but what seems to be power cycling , on for a few seconds then off for a few then back on again etc etc same for both voltages and fan spins .

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Check CPU_VCCST_PWRGD and CPU_VR_READY.
Also check presence for all voltages on page 11.

There are many power rails to check on pages 59 & 60 too.

Just in case, try turning on in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
CPU_VCCST_PWRGD = 1.047v
CPU_VR_READY = 1.052v
Page 11 , 59 & 60 all voltages present ( that took cooking ages! ) :D

SMC Bypass samer shit,

I can't see any reason this shouldn't power up and play, But fan spin and cpu getting warm is all we get.

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Is the board power cycling now?

Try known good BIOS...

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
Power cycling seems to have stopped or only happens after long periods of being turned on when testing voltages, 


I'm currently in the process of ordering a Medusa ( And a pile of  Tiresias (the GPUkiller) chips ) from Harald but he is currently on vacation until the 23rd of june

Without a Medusa would I need to remove the bios chip to try good bios? Or am I best of waiting till the Medusa arrives?

( Also I notice there are 3 different versions of the Medusa what version would you recommend I get?

threads.title: 820-3476-a Power no display
threads.message:
I don't know if Harald has newer version than 3, for Medusa.
I got version 2 long time ago and still does the things I need.
Probably is better to get version 3, or which one is latest.
Be sure to get all necessary adapters, to connect all kind of boards and single chips.
He has in stock some board adapters with 1.8V support.

I'm still pending to test his battery port tester, received few weeks ago.

Is not dificult to flash SPI chip outside of the board, using cheapest CH4341, or other programmer.

I've just tyred searching the board for a clean ME bios for this board but don't see one posted recently. Would you have a good bios file I could try please?

Also could you give us your feedback on the battery port tester when you have had a chance to try it out.
